item.title: Potjy add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Indeed I have always been of the opinion that hard work is simply the refuge of people who have nothing to do." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "A mind is like a parachute. It doesn't work if it is not open." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "In a fight between yourself and the world, always side with the world." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "Do not ask who I am and do not ask me to remain the same. More than one person, doubtless like me, writes in order to have no face." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "When men stop believing in God, it isn't that they then believe in nothing: they believe in everything." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I don't believe in aging. I believe in forever altering one's aspect to the sun. " -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Lilian Jackson Braun
item.description: "Are those cat hairs on your lapel, or have you been dating a blonde with a crew cut?" -- Lilian Jackson Braun

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are the perfect entertainment: no commercials, no batteries, hours of enjoyment for each dollar spent. What I wonder is why everybody doesn't carry a book around for those inevitable dead spots in life." -- Stephen King

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "There are books full of great writing that don't have very good stories. Read sometimes for the story... don't be like the book-snobs who won't do that. Read sometimes for the words--the language. Don't be like the play-it-safers who won't do that. But when you find a book that has both a good story and good words, treasure that book." -- Stephen King

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If I have to spend time in purgatory before going to one place or the other, I guess I'll be all right as long as there's a lending library." -- Stephen King

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Rex Stout
item.description: "[A] pessimist gets nothing but pleasant surprises, an optimist nothing but unpleasant." -- Rex Stout

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Lilian Jackson Braun
item.description: "Dogs have their day but cats have 365." -- Lilian Jackson Braun

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Lilian Jackson Braun
item.description: "People who really appreciated animals always asked their names." -- Lilian Jackson Braun

item.title: Potjy add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie
